2024 年 1 月 18 日星期四 02:22:41 +0000每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks TED - TED.com TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到 TED 演讲，这些演讲激发、激发和激发了一些世界领先的思想家和实干家的想象力，他们在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地的合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 TED 会议上值得传播的想法泰德TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到 TED 演讲，这些演讲激发、激发和激发了一些世界领先的思想家和实干家的想象力，他们在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地的合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 zh知识共享：https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/泰德contact@ted.com https://pl.tedcdn.com/rss_feed_images/ted_talks_main_podcast/video.png每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks 144 144 科学技术娱乐设计 TED、TEDTalks、TED 演讲、灵感、创造力、技术演示、教育不非成人的
如果广告是诚实的怎么办？ |西尔维斯特·乔克西尔维斯特·乔克After years of brand building, marketing veteran Sylvester Chauke realized that his industry had sold the world on overconsumption, with devastating consequences. He shares how marketers could instead promote sustainability with "honest ads" that do right by the planet and encourage people to think twice before buying.如果广告是诚实的怎么办？ |西尔维斯特·乔克After years of brand building, marketing veteran Sylvester Chauke realized that his industry had sold the world on overconsumption, with devastating consequences. He shares how marketers could instead promote sustainability with "honest ads" that do right by the planet and encourage people to think twice before buying. https://www.ted.com/talks/sylvester_chauke_what_if_advertising_was_honest?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:123147 123147 Wed, 17 Jan 2024 15:48:21 +0000高等教育不00:11:29泰德
野生动物之美——以及保护野生动物的艺术呼吁|伊莎贝拉柯克兰伊莎贝拉柯克兰"I think of my paintings as alarm clocks," says artist Isabella Kirkland. "They're reminders of what's at stake; the only problem is we keep pushing the snooze button." Investigating humanity's relationship to nature, she shares work that takes a creative stand against ecological despair — and quietly urges climate action through permanent images of vanishing wildlife.野生动物之美——以及保护野生动物的艺术呼吁|伊莎贝拉柯克兰"I think of my paintings as alarm clocks," says artist Isabella Kirkland. "They're reminders of what's at stake; the only problem is we keep pushing the snooze button." Investigating humanity's relationship to nature, she shares work that takes a creative stand against ecological despair — and quietly urges climate action through permanent images of vanishing wildlife. https://www.ted.com/talks/isabella_kirkland_the_beauty_of_wildlife_and_an_artistic_call_to_protect_it?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:118716 118716 Tue, 16 Jan 2024 15:55:47 +0000高等教育不00:08:38泰德
让好奇心引领|亚拉·沙希迪亚拉·沙希迪Don't second-guess what "distracts" you, says actor-producer Yara Shahidi; that's your curiosity coming through. The star of hit shows like "black-ish" and "grown-ish" tells how she learned to spot clues to her own future — and how you can, too.让好奇心引领|亚拉·沙希迪Don't second-guess what "distracts" you, says actor-producer Yara Shahidi; that's your curiosity coming through. 人工智能可以给你 X 光视力吗？ |塔拉·博鲁沙基塔拉·博鲁沙基What if a robot could find and deliver your lost phone? AI researcher Tara Boroushaki presents how she's using wireless signals and sensors to create AI-powered goggles with "X-ray vision," creating a dynamic new tool with applications from improving efficiency in commercial warehouses to aiding emergency rescues.人工智能可以给你 X 光视力吗？ |塔拉·博鲁沙基What if a robot could find and deliver your lost phone? AI researcher Tara Boroushaki presents how she's using wireless signals and sensors to create AI-powered goggles with "X-ray vision," creating a dynamic new tool with applications from improving efficiency in commercial warehouses to aiding emergency rescues. https://www.ted.com/talks/tara_boroushaki_could_ai_give_you_x_ray_vision?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:124014 124014 Fri, 12 Jan 2024 16:00:06 +0000高等教育不00:06:43泰德
当我们拒绝人们堕胎时会发生什么？ |戴安娜·格林·福斯特戴安娜·格林·福斯特How does getting an abortion — or not — influence a woman's life? Demographer Diana Greene Foster puts forward the results of The Turnaway Study, her landmark work following nearly 1,000 women through abortion or childbirth, presenting definitive data on the long-term physical, mental and economic impacts of the right to choose on pregnant people and their families. "Access to abortion is about control over one's body, life and destiny," says Foster.当我们拒绝人们堕胎时会发生什么？ |戴安娜·格林·福斯特How does getting an abortion — or not — influence a woman's life? Demographer Diana Greene Foster puts forward the results of The Turnaway Study, her landmark work following nearly 1,000 women through abortion or childbirth, presenting definitive data on the long-term physical, mental and economic impacts of the right to choose on pregnant people and their families. "Access to abortion is about control over one's body, life and destiny," says Foster. https://www.ted.com/talks/diana_greene_foster_what_happens_when_we_deny_people_abortions?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:122059 122059 Thu, 11 Jan 2024 15:59:19 +0000高等教育不00:14:00泰德
如何在独裁国家建立民主|泰莎·乌德瓦赫伊泰莎·乌德瓦赫伊"Today, Hungary is in the gray zone between a dictatorship and a democracy," says activist Tessza Udvarhelyi. "This did not happen overnight." In a rousing talk, she reminds us just how close any country can come to authoritarianism — and offers on-the-ground lessons for how to keep democracy alive through focus, determination and imagination. (Followed by a brief Q&A with TED curator Cloe Shasha Brooks)如何在独裁国家建立民主|泰莎·乌德瓦赫伊"Today, Hungary is in the gray zone between a dictatorship and a democracy," says activist Tessza Udvarhelyi. "This did not happen overnight." In a rousing talk, she reminds us just how close any country can come to authoritarianism — and offers on-the-ground lessons for how to keep democracy alive through focus, determination and imagination. (Followed by a brief Q&A with TED curator Cloe Shasha Brooks) https://www.ted.com/talks/tessza_udvarhelyi_how_to_build_democracy_in_an_authorarian_country?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:123187 123187 Wed, 10 Jan 2024 15:42:52 +0000高等教育不00:12:46泰德
美国与自身的对抗——以及 2024 年其他主要全球风险 |伊恩·布雷默伊恩·布雷默2024 will be a dangerous year for the world, says Ian Bremmer, president and founder of Eurasia Group and GZERO Media. Forecasting the top geopolitical risks set to play out in the months to come, he untangles what's in store for the war in Ukraine, the state of the Israel-Hamas conflict and the tensions putting democracy in the United States to the test — all while AI continues to evolve faster than governments can regulate it. (This interview, hosted by TED's Helen Walters, was recorded on January 8, 2024.)美国与自身的对抗——以及 2024 年其他主要全球风险 |伊恩·布雷默2024 will be a dangerous year for the world, says Ian Bremmer, president and founder of Eurasia Group and GZERO Media. Forecasting the top geopolitical risks set to play out in the months to come, he untangles what's in store for the war in Ukraine, the state of the Israel-Hamas conflict and the tensions putting democracy in the United States to the test — all while AI continues to evolve faster than governments can regulate it. (This interview, hosted by TED's Helen Walters, was recorded on January 8, 2024.) https://www.ted.com/talks/ian_bremmer_the_us_vs_itself_and_other_top_global_risks_in_2024?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:124005 124005 Tue, 09 Jan 2024 20:50:03 +0000高等教育不00:42:51泰德
现在是富有感染力的慷慨的时候了。方法如下 |克里斯·安德森克里斯·安德森What would happen to humanity if generosity went viral? Sharing transformative stories from around the world, head of TED Chris Anderson outlines why the time has come for the internet to realize its power to supercharge small acts of kindness, changing lives at a scale never experienced before. Learn how to cultivate a generous mindset — with or without giving money — and get inspired with tools to amplify your impact. "Be brave. Give what you can, and then be absolutely amazed at what happens next," Anderson says.现在是富有感染力的慷慨的时候了。方法如下 |克里斯·安德森What would happen to humanity if generosity went viral? Sharing transformative stories from around the world, head of TED Chris Anderson outlines why the time has come for the internet to realize its power to supercharge small acts of kindness, changing lives at a scale never experienced before. Learn how to cultivate a generous mindset — with or without giving money — and get inspired with tools to amplify your impact. "Be brave. Give what you can, and then be absolutely amazed at what happens next," Anderson says. https://www.ted.com/talks/chris_anderson_it_s_time_for_infectious_generosity_here_s_how?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:123235 123235 Tue, 09 Jan 2024 17:36:54 +0000高等教育不00:19:28泰德
替代肉类是打造更健康星球的良方吗？ |张涛张涛A Chinese saying goes, "There's no pleasure in eating without meat." And the data backs that up: every year, China consumes 26 percent of the world's meat and 45 percent of its seafood — numbers that could grow alongside rising incomes. Impact investor Tao Zhang shows why getting Chinese consumers to switch to plant-based alternatives is vital to tackling climate change and explores how it's also a massive business opportunity to bring tasty, affordable new proteins to market.替代肉类是打造更健康星球的良方吗？ |张涛A Chinese saying goes, "There's no pleasure in eating without meat." And the data backs that up: every year, China consumes 26 percent of the world's meat and 45 percent of its seafood — numbers that could grow alongside rising incomes. Impact investor Tao Zhang shows why getting Chinese consumers to switch to plant-based alternatives is vital to tackling climate change and explores how it's also a massive business opportunity to bring tasty, affordable new proteins to market. https://www.ted.com/talks/tao_zhang_is_alternative_meat_the_recipe_for_a_healthier_planet?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:118892 118892 Mon, 08 Jan 2024 15:53:49 +0000高等教育不00:10:48泰德
繁文缛节已经够多了——我们需要对清洁能源说“是”|里奇·鲍威尔里奇·鲍威尔Climate innovation leader Rich Powell dives into the bureaucracy, bottlenecks and not-in-my-backyard attitude preventing the US from achieving its green energy goals, warning that we need about 10,000 new clean energy projects to be built in the US this decade if we're to reach net zero by 2050. Learn more about what's needed to fight NIMBYism, get serious about the energy transition — and get out of our own way.繁文缛节已经够多了——我们需要对清洁能源说“是”|里奇·鲍威尔Climate innovation leader Rich Powell dives into the bureaucracy, bottlenecks and not-in-my-backyard attitude preventing the US from achieving its green energy goals, warning that we need about 10,000 new clean energy projects to be built in the US this decade if we're to reach net zero by 2050. Learn more about what's needed to fight NIMBYism, get serious about the energy transition — and get out of our own way. https://www.ted.com/talks/rich_powell_enough_red_tape_we_need_to_say_yes_to_clean_energy?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:122192 122192 Fri, 05 Jan 2024 15:59:25 +0000高等教育不00:11:35泰德
不要对你的咖啡师做混蛋——以及对一线工作的其他想法|阿德里安·内格雷罗斯阿德里安·内格雷罗斯All jobs, especially those held by frontline workers, should have dignity and the ability to turn into great careers, says change management expert Adriann Negreros. From shift flexibility to ending work on time, he outlines what he calls the "handbook of humanity" — people-centered ideas for change, rooted in empathy — that, when implemented, can redefine the nature of frontline work.不要对你的咖啡师做混蛋——以及对一线工作的其他想法|阿德里安·内格雷罗斯All jobs, especially those held by frontline workers, should have dignity and the ability to turn into great careers, says change management expert Adriann Negreros. From shift flexibility to ending work on time, he outlines what he calls the "handbook of humanity" — people-centered ideas for change, rooted in empathy — that, when implemented, can redefine the nature of frontline work. https://www.ted.com/talks/adriann_negreros_don_t_be_a_jerk_to_your_barista_and_other_thoughts_on_frontline_work?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:122878 122878 Fri, 05 Jan 2024 15:54:34 +0000高等教育不00:12:41泰德
